title: 1 John Chapter 2 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on 1 John chapter 2 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: 1 John Chapter 2 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of 1 John Chapter 2.

questions.question: According to 1 John 2:1, who is the advocate with the Father for those who sin?
questions.explanation: 1 John 2:1 states that Jesus Christ the righteous is the advocate with the Father for those who sin.

questions.question: What does 1 John 2:2 say Jesus is for our sins?
questions.explanation: 1 John 2:2 explains that Jesus is the propitiation for our sins, and not for ours only but for the whole world.

questions.question: According to 1 John 2:3, how do we know that we know Him?
questions.explanation: 1 John 2:3 states that we know we know Him if we keep His commandments.

questions.question: True or False: 1 John 2:4 says that if someone says they know Him but does not keep His commandments, the truth is in them.
questions.explanation: 1 John 2:4 says that if someone says they know Him but does not keep His commandments, he is a liar and the truth is not in him.

questions.question: Who abides in the light according to 1 John 2:10?
questions.explanation: 1 John 2:10 teaches that he who loves his brother abides in the light and has no occasion of stumbling.

questions.question: Fill in the blank from 1 John 2:12: 'I write unto you, little children, because your ______ are forgiven you for his name's sake.'
questions.explanation: 1 John 2:12 clearly states that sins are forgiven for His name's sake.

questions.question: According to 1 John 2:15, what should we not love?
options: The world and the things in the world
questions.correctAnswer: The world and the things in the world
questions.explanation: 1 John 2:15 commands not to love the world nor the things in it, because loving the world means the love of the Father is not in us.

questions.question: What are the three things mentioned in 1 John 2:16 that are not of the Father?
options: The lust of the flesh, the lust of the eyes, and the pride of life
questions.correctAnswer: The lust of the flesh, the lust of the eyes, and the pride of life
questions.explanation: 1 John 2:16 specifies these three as belonging to the world, not the Father.

questions.question: True or False: 1 John 2:17 says the world and its lust will last forever.
questions.explanation: 1 John 2:17 states that the world and its lust pass away, but those who do God's will abide forever.

questions.question: Who does 1 John 2:22 identify as the liar and antichrist?
options: He who denies that Jesus is the Christ
questions.correctAnswer: He who denies that Jesus is the Christ
questions.explanation: 1 John 2:22 says that anyone who denies Jesus is the Christ is a liar and the antichrist.

questions.question: According to 1 John 2:23, whosoever acknowledges the Son also has whom?
questions.explanation: 1 John 2:23 teaches that whoever acknowledges the Son has the Father also.

questions.question: True or False: 1 John 2:20 says believers have an unction from the Holy One and know all things.
questions.explanation: 1 John 2:20 states that believers have an anointing from the Holy One and know all things.

questions.question: What is the promise mentioned in 1 John 2:25?
questions.explanation: 1 John 2:25 affirms that the promise God has given us is eternal life.

questions.question: According to 1 John 2:27, what teaches us all things and is truth without any lie?
questions.explanation: 1 John 2:27 states that the anointing believers have received teaches them all things and is truth without any lie.

questions.question: Complete this verse from 1 John 2:28: 'And now, little children, abide in him; that, when he shall appear, we may have confidence, and not be ______ before him at his coming.'
questions.explanation: 1 John 2:28 encourages believers to abide in Him so that we may not be ashamed at His coming.

medium.title: 1 John Chapter 2 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from 1 John Chapter 2 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer struggles with guilt after sinning. Based on 1 John 2, what biblical truth would you share to encourage them?
options: Jesus Christ is our advocate with the Father, who intercedes for us.
We must confess all sins to others before receiving forgiveness.
Once we sin, we lose God's love permanently.
We should avoid fellowship until we are sinless.
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus Christ is our advocate with the Father, who intercedes for us.
questions.explanation: 1 John 2:1 explains that Jesus Christ is an advocate for believers when they sin, offering forgiveness and intercession. This encourages believers not to despair but to trust in His righteous advocacy. Also see 1 John 2:2 and 1 John 2:12 for the assurance of forgiveness and Christ's propitiation.

questions.question: How does 1 John 2 teach us about the relationship between knowing God and obedience?
options: Knowing God is proven by keeping His commandments.
Obedience is optional for those who know God.
Knowing God means avoiding all commandments.
Obedience only matters for church leaders.
questions.correctAnswer: Knowing God is proven by keeping His commandments.
questions.explanation: Verses 3 and 4 emphasize that true knowledge of God is demonstrated through obedience to His commandments. Claiming to know God without obedience is called lying and lacking truth. This highlights the practical link between faith and daily living.

questions.question: In what way does 1 John 2 describe the love of God being perfected in a believer?
questions.explanation: 1 John 2:5 states that the love of God is perfected in those who keep His word, showing that obedience nurtures and completes God's love within us. This teaches believers to align their lives with God's commands to mature in love.

questions.question: A believer asks how to imitate Jesus in daily life. What does 1 John 2 say about this?
options: We should walk as Jesus walked.
We should isolate ourselves to avoid temptations.
We should focus only on spiritual matters, ignoring practical life.
We must perform miracles like Jesus.
questions.correctAnswer: We should walk as Jesus walked.
questions.explanation: 1 John 2:6 instructs that anyone who claims to abide in Christ ought to walk just as He walked, emphasizing imitation of Jesus' example in everyday conduct as essential for spiritual living.

questions.question: How does 1 John 2 contrast loving and hating a brother in the context of spiritual light and darkness?
options: Loving a brother means abiding in the light; hating means walking in darkness.
Hating a brother is a sign of spiritual growth.
Loving a brother leads to darkness.
Hating or loving brothers has no spiritual significance.
questions.correctAnswer: Loving a brother means abiding in the light; hating means walking in darkness.
questions.explanation: Verses 9-11 describe that those who love their brother abide in the light without stumbling, whereas hatred signifies walking in darkness and blindness. This teaches believers the practical importance of love in reflecting God's light.

questions.question: According to 1 John 2, what reason is given for writing to 'little children'?
options: Because their sins are forgiven for His name's sake.
Because they are not yet believers.
Because they should avoid the world entirely.
questions.correctAnswer: Because their sins are forgiven for His name's sake.
questions.explanation: 1 John 2:12 states that the author writes to 'little children' because their sins have been forgiven on account of Jesus' name, encouraging assurance of forgiveness and identity in Christ.

questions.question: What practical advice about worldly love does 1 John 2 offer to believers?
options: Do not love the world or its desires, because such love excludes the Father's love.
Loving worldly things is a sign of spiritual maturity.
The world should be loved above all else.
Worldly desires are neutral to faith.
questions.correctAnswer: Do not love the world or its desires, because such love excludes the Father's love.
questions.explanation: Verses 15-16 warn believers against loving the world and its lusts, emphasizing that such love means the love of the Father is not in them. This teaches practical spiritual discipline to prioritize God over worldly temptations.

questions.question: A believer is confused about how to recognize false teachers. What does 1 John 2 say about identifying them?
options: They deny that Jesus is the Christ and are antichrists.
They perform signs to prove themselves.
They always preach love without doctrine.
questions.correctAnswer: They deny that Jesus is the Christ and are antichrists.
questions.explanation: 1 John 2:22 explains that anyone who denies Jesus as the Christ is a liar and antichrist, helping believers discern false teachers by their denial of fundamental truth about Jesus.

questions.question: True or False: According to 1 John 2, the promise of eternal life depends on doing the will of God.
questions.explanation: 1 John 2:17 states that while the world and its lusts pass away, the one who does the will of God abides forever, linking eternal life to obedience and faithfulness in practical living.

questions.question: What does 1 John 2 say about the 'unction' or anointing believers have received?
options: It teaches believers all things and abides in them without need for another's teaching.
It only applies to church leaders.
It is a temporary feeling that fades quickly.
It requires constant human instruction to be effective.
questions.correctAnswer: It teaches believers all things and abides in them without need for another's teaching.
questions.explanation: 1 John 2:20 and 2:27 describe the anointing from the Holy One as indwelling and teaching believers all truth, enabling them to abide in Christ without needing continual external teaching.

questions.question: How does 1 John 2 encourage believers to respond to the coming of Christ?
options: By abiding in Christ to have confidence and not be ashamed at His appearing.
By ignoring His coming and focusing on worldly matters.
By trying to predict the exact day of His return.
By avoiding fellowship with other believers.
questions.correctAnswer: By abiding in Christ to have confidence and not be ashamed at His appearing.
questions.explanation: 1 John 2:28 encourages believers to abide in Christ so that when He appears, they will have confidence and not be ashamed, emphasizing practical daily faithfulness and devotion.

questions.question: A young believer feels weak in spiritual battles. What encouragement does 1 John 2 offer specifically to young men?
options: Young men are strong, and the word of God abides in them, helping them overcome the wicked one.
Young men must rely solely on their own strength.
Young men are exempt from spiritual struggles.
Young men should avoid all trials to stay strong.
questions.correctAnswer: Young men are strong, and the word of God abides in them, helping them overcome the wicked one.
questions.explanation: 1 John 2:13-14 affirms that young men are strong because God's word abides in them and they have overcome the wicked one, offering practical encouragement for spiritual perseverance.

questions.question: True or False: According to 1 John 2, those who deny the Son also have the Father.
questions.explanation: 1 John 2:23 states that whoever denies the Son does not have the Father, but whoever acknowledges the Son has the Father also, highlighting the inseparable relationship between Father and Son in salvation.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 1 John 2 teaches that the old commandment is the word which you have heard from the _______.
questions.explanation: 1 John 2:7 states that the old commandment is the word which the believers had from the beginning, emphasizing continuity in God's revealed truth.

questions.question: According to 1 John 2, what happens to those who went out from the fellowship but were not truly of it?
options: They left so that it may be made manifest that they were not all of us.
They left because they were more spiritual.
They left and will be welcomed back without repentance.
They left to start a better church.
questions.correctAnswer: They left so that it may be made manifest that they were not all of us.
questions.explanation: 1 John 2:19 explains that those who went out were not truly of the community because if they had been, they would have continued, and their departure reveals their true status, warning believers about genuine fellowship and apostasy.

hard.title: 1 John Chapter 2 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from 1 John Chapter 2.

questions.question: In 1 John 2:1, who is described as the advocate with the Father for those who sin?
questions.explanation: 1 John 2:1 identifies Jesus Christ as the advocate with the Father for sinners, emphasizing His role as mediator and righteous intercessor.

questions.question: According to 1 John 2:2, Jesus is the propitiation not only for our sins but also for whose sins?
options: The sins of the whole world
The sins of the Gentiles only
questions.correctAnswer: The sins of the whole world
questions.explanation: 1 John 2:2 teaches the universal scope of Christ's atoning work, stating He is the propitiation for the sins of the whole world.

questions.question: What is the sign that one truly knows Jesus, according to 1 John 2:3?
questions.explanation: 1 John 2:3 clarifies that genuine knowledge of Jesus is demonstrated by obedience to His commandments.

questions.question: How does 1 John 2:4 describe a person who claims to know Jesus but does not keep His commandments?
questions.explanation: According to 1 John 2:4, such a person is called a liar because truth is not in them.

questions.question: What is perfected in one who keeps God's word, as stated in 1 John 2:5?
questions.explanation: 1 John 2:5 teaches that in those who keep God's word, the love of God is perfected, indicating spiritual maturity.

questions.question: According to 1 John 2:6, how ought the one who claims to abide in Jesus walk?
options: According to the law of Moses
In the ways of the Pharisees
questions.explanation: 1 John 2:6 uses a parallelism that demands believers walk as Jesus walked, emphasizing imitation of Christ's life.

questions.question: The 'new commandment' mentioned in 1 John 2:8 is said to be true in whom?
options: In the temple and the land
questions.explanation: 1 John 2:8 states the new commandment is true in Jesus ('Him') and in the believers ('you'), reflecting a relational dynamic.

questions.question: What consequence does 1 John 2:9 associate with hating one's brother despite claiming to be in the light?
options: Being in darkness even until now
questions.correctAnswer: Being in darkness even until now
questions.explanation: According to 1 John 2:9, hatred towards a brother contradicts the claim of being in the light and results in remaining in darkness.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 1 John 2:15 warns, 'Love not the _______, neither the things that are in the world.'
questions.explanation: 1 John 2:15 explicitly commands believers not to love the world or its things, contrasting worldly love with the love of the Father.

questions.question: According to 1 John 2:16, which of the following is NOT listed as part of 'all that is in the world'?
questions.explanation: 1 John 2:16 lists lust of the flesh, lust of the eyes, and pride of life as worldly, contrasting them with godly faith which is not part of the world.

questions.question: What does 1 John 2:17 say will happen to the world and its lust, and who abides forever?
options: The world passeth away, but he that doeth the will of God abideth forever
The world is eternal, but the righteous perish
The world is victorious, but the wicked suffer
The world remains, but the faithful are forgotten
questions.correctAnswer: The world passeth away, but he that doeth the will of God abideth forever
questions.explanation: 1 John 2:17 contrasts the temporary nature of the world and its desires with the eternal nature of those who do God's will.

questions.question: True or False: 1 John 2:18 says that many antichrists have already come as a sign of the last time.
questions.explanation: 1 John 2:18 explicitly states that many antichrists have come, indicating that it is the last time.

questions.question: In 1 John 2:22, who is called a liar and antichrist?
options: He that denieth that Jesus is the Christ
questions.correctAnswer: He that denieth that Jesus is the Christ
questions.explanation: 1 John 2:22 identifies the one who denies Jesus as the Christ as a liar and antichrist, highlighting the importance of Christological confession.

questions.question: According to 1 John 2:24, what must remain in believers so they continue in the Son and the Father?
options: That which ye have heard from the beginning
questions.correctAnswer: That which ye have heard from the beginning
questions.explanation: 1 John 2:24 exhorts believers to let the original teaching remain in them to maintain fellowship with the Son and the Father.

questions.question: What promise is mentioned in 1 John 2:25 that God has given to believers?
questions.explanation: 1 John 2:25 clearly states that the promise God has given believers is eternal life, a central theme in Johannine theology.

theological.title: 1 John Chapter 2 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from 1 John Chapter 2 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to 1 John 2:1, who is described as the advocate with the Father for those who sin?
questions.explanation: 1 John 2:1 states that Jesus Christ the righteous is our advocate with the Father when we sin. This aligns with other Scriptures such as Romans 8:34, Hebrews 7:25, and John 1:29 which reveal Christ’s intercessory role.

questions.question: What does 1 John 2:2 say Jesus Christ is for the sins of the whole world?
questions.explanation: 1 John 2:2 teaches that Jesus is the propitiation for our sins and for the whole world, showing the universal scope of His atonement, consistent with John 3:16, Romans 3:25, and Hebrews 2:17.

questions.question: According to 1 John 2:3, how do we know that we know Him?
questions.explanation: The verse states that knowing God is evidenced by obedience to His commandments, reflecting the biblical principle in John 14:15, James 2:19-20, and Deuteronomy 6:5.

questions.question: What does 1 John 2:4 say about someone who claims to know God but does not keep His commandments?
options: He is a liar, and the truth is not in him
questions.correctAnswer: He is a liar, and the truth is not in him
questions.explanation: This verse firmly states that claiming to know God without obedience is lying, consistent with Jesus' teaching in John 14:21 and James 2:14-26 regarding faith and works.

questions.question: What is perfected in the one who keeps God's word according to 1 John 2:5?
questions.explanation: 1 John 2:5 indicates that God's love is perfected in those who keep His word, echoing themes found in John 15:10, Romans 5:5, and 1 Corinthians 13 regarding the maturity of love.

questions.question: According to 1 John 2:6, how ought he who says he abides in Christ to walk?
questions.explanation: The verse calls believers to imitate Christ's walk, paralleling Ephesians 5:1, 1 Peter 2:21, and John 13:15 which emphasize Christlike living.

questions.question: What does 1 John 2:7 describe as not new but old, which was from the beginning?
questions.explanation: This verse states the commandment is old and known from the beginning, consistent with Jesus' new commandment in John 13:34 that fulfills the old law (Leviticus 19:18).

questions.question: In 1 John 2:8, what reason is given for the new commandment being true in Him and in us?
options: Because the darkness is past, and the true light now shineth
Because the law has been abolished
questions.correctAnswer: Because the darkness is past, and the true light now shineth
questions.explanation: This highlights the transition from darkness to light in Christ, consistent with John 1:5, John 8:12, and Isaiah 9:2 which portray Christ as the true light.

questions.question: What does 1 John 2:9 say about one who claims to be in the light but hates his brother?
options: He is in darkness even until now
questions.correctAnswer: He is in darkness even until now
questions.explanation: The verse shows that hatred contradicts being in the light, matching Jesus' teaching in John 13:34-35 and Paul's instructions in Romans 13:10.

questions.question: According to 1 John 2:15, why should we not love the world or the things in the world?
options: Because if anyone loves the world, the love of the Father is not in him
Because the world is evil itself
Because the world is under Satan
questions.correctAnswer: Because if anyone loves the world, the love of the Father is not in him
questions.explanation: This verse teaches that love for the world excludes the love of the Father, consistent with Jesus' teaching in Matthew 6:24 and James 4:4 about divided loyalty.

questions.question: What are the three things mentioned in 1 John 2:16 that are not of the Father but of the world?
options: The lust of the flesh, the lust of the eyes, and the pride of life
The law, the prophets, and the temple
The sin, the guilt, and the shame
The greed, the envy, and the wrath
questions.correctAnswer: The lust of the flesh, the lust of the eyes, and the pride of life
questions.explanation: This triad represents worldly temptations, paralleling Jesus' temptation narrative in Matthew 4:1-11 and Paul's teaching in Galatians 5:16-17.

questions.question: According to 1 John 2:17, what happens to the world and its lust, and what happens to the one who does the will of God?
options: The world passes away, but he that does the will of God abides forever
The world increases, but the believer dwindles
The world prospers, but the righteous suffer
The world is judged, but the believer is condemned
questions.correctAnswer: The world passes away, but he that does the will of God abides forever
questions.explanation: The verse contrasts the temporal nature of the world with eternal life for those who obey God, consistent with Matthew 6:19-21 and 2 Corinthians 4:18.

questions.question: In 1 John 2:18, how do we know that it is the last time?
questions.explanation: The presence of many antichrists indicates the last time, matching Jesus’ eschatological warnings in Matthew 24:24 and Paul’s teaching in 2 Thessalonians 2:3.

questions.question: What does 1 John 2:22 say about anyone who denies that Jesus is the Christ?
options: He is a liar and the antichrist
questions.correctAnswer: He is a liar and the antichrist
questions.explanation: Denying Jesus as the Christ is equated with being antichrist and a liar, consistent with John 1:1-3, 1 Timothy 2:5, and 2 John 1:7.

questions.question: According to 1 John 2:25, what is the promise God has promised us?
questions.explanation: The promise of eternal life is affirmed here, echoing John 3:16, Romans 6:23, and Titus 1:2 which emphasize life through God’s grace.
